alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:56PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Water Levels on Interior Rivers... The long stretch of warm temperatures across the Interior continues with glacier melt and snowmelt at higher elevations bringing glacier fed river levels up. The Tanana river continues to run near bankfull to bankfull with some water making its way into low lying areas near the river, and also bringing the water levels in adjacent sloughs up to bankfull. Ground water near the rivers will continue to rise closer to the surface as the river levels remain elevated, with elevated groundwater also spreading further away from the river. Warm temperatures will continue through most of next week before a weather front brings cooler temperatures. Glacially fed rivers will continue to run at elevated levels so residents should use caution on and near them. For the latest river information go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
